Description: Low conical foot sherd of Chian early patterned or Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black (fired red) in bottom of bowl with reserved dot in centre; exterior: reserved at junction of foot and bowl; glazed black on foot; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: The number in Petrie's catalogue, '36', is written in pencil on the underside of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 36)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0311) (phase 2)
